medical_history.chief_complaint: Patients presented with cutaneous nodules and arthralgias.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms developed suddenly; duration varied from several months to years across cases. Specific cases noted symptoms starting after an upper respiratory tract infection (6 weeks prior) or developing gradually over 2 years.
medical_history.past_medical_history: One patient had a recent diagnosis of hepatitis C; otherwise, medical histories varied and included chronic conditions such as recurrent polyarthritis.
medical_history.family_history: Family history included rheumatoid arthritis in paternal grandmother and Crohn's disease in maternal grandmother for one patient; another patient had a father with multiple sclerosis and a maternal aunt with Sj√∂gren syndrome.
